title: Parentheses
text: The first step is to simplify the parentheses.
speech: The first step is to simplify the parentheses.
pacedSpeech: The first step is to simplify the parentheses.

title: Simplify
speech: Simlify the expression:  the square root of 25 minus 9 end root is equal to, the square root of 16
pacedSpeech: Simlify the expression:   the square root of 25 minus 9 end root is equal to, the square root of 16

title: Principal Square Root
text: The principal square root of a is the nonnegative number that, when multiplied by itself, equals a. It is written as a radical expression, with a symbol called a radical over the term called the radicand: $$\sqrt{a}$$.
speech: The principal square root of a is the nonnegative number that, when multiplied by itself, equals a. It is written as a radical expression, with a symbol called a radical over the term called the radicand:  the square root of a .
pacedSpeech: The principal square root of a is the nonnegative number that, when multiplied by itself, equals a. It is written as a radical expression, with a symbol called a radical over the term called the radicand:   the square root of a

title: Principal Square Root
text: What number multiplied by itself equals 16?
speech: What number multiplied by itself equals 16?
pacedSpeech: What number multiplied by itself equals 16?
